optimizeAlarms.pageDescription: Use artificial intelligence to adjust your greenhouse alarm settings for optimized cocoa fermentation. Provide your specific conditions, and our AI will suggest personalized temperature limits.
optimizeAlarmsForm.title: AI Alarm Optimization
optimizeAlarmsForm.description: Provide details about your cocoa cultivation to receive AI-based recommendations for optimal temperature alarm limits. All data is processed securely.
optimizeAlarmsForm.microclimateInfoPlace: Describe humidity levels, sun exposure, ventilation systems, greenhouse size, etc.
optimizeAlarmsForm.historicalDataDescrip: Provide a JSON array of objects, each with "timestamp" (Unix milliseconds) and "temperature" (Celsius) fields.
optimizeAlarmsForm.historicalDataError: Historical data is required and must be valid JSON.
optimizeAlarmsForm.unknownError: An unknown error occurred during optimization.

hardwareAssembly.title: Hardware Assembly Guide
hardwareAssembly.description: Follow this step-by-step guide to assemble your first temperature sensor prototype with ESP32 and DS18B20.
hardwareAssembly.component5: 4.7kΩ Resistor (if not using an adapter module)
hardwareAssembly.component6: USB cable to connect the ESP32 to the computer
hardwareAssembly.wiringDiagramDescriptio: The image below illustrates how the components should be connected. Follow the wire colors for ease.
hardwareAssembly.wiringDiagramAlt: Wiring diagram of ESP32 with DS18B20 sensor
hardwareAssembly.step1Title: Position the ESP32 on the Breadboard
hardwareAssembly.step1Description: Fit the ESP32 board in the center of the breadboard, straddling the central divider. This allows you to access the pins on both sides.
hardwareAssembly.step2Description: Use jumpers to connect the '3V3' (or 3.3V) pin of the ESP32 to the positive power rail (+) of the breadboard (usually marked in red). Connect the 'GND' pin of the ESP32 to the negative ground rail (-) of the breadboard (marked in blue).
hardwareAssembly.step3Description: Plug the DS18B20 sensor into the breadboard. Connect the VCC (power) pin of the sensor to the positive rail (+). Connect the GND pin of the sensor to the negative rail (-). Connect the DATA pin of the sensor to a GPIO pin on the ESP32, such as pin 'GPIO 4' (or D4).
hardwareAssembly.step4Description: Connect the 4.7kΩ resistor between the DATA pin of the sensor and the positive power rail (+). This step is crucial for communication. **Note:** If you are using an adapter module for the DS18B20, this resistor is already included on the module's board and this step can be skipped.
hardwareAssembly.configuratorCard.title: Generate Your Custom Code
hardwareAssembly.configuratorCard.descri: Instead of manually editing code, use our interactive configurator to generate the exact code for your device with just a few clicks. It's easier and less error-prone.
hardwareAssembly.wifiConfig.title: How to Connect the Device to Wi-Fi
hardwareAssembly.wifiConfig.description: Your device uses the "WiFiManager" portal to connect to any network. Follow the steps below the first time you power on the device or if you need to change networks.
hardwareAssembly.wifiConfig.step1.title: Power On the Device for the First Time
hardwareAssembly.wifiConfig.step1.descri: Connect your ESP32 to a power source (USB). Since it doesn't know any network yet, it will create its own Wi-Fi access point.
hardwareAssembly.wifiConfig.step2.title: Connect to the Device's Network
hardwareAssembly.wifiConfig.step2.descri: On your phone or computer, search for Wi-Fi networks. Find and connect to a network called:
hardwareAssembly.wifiConfig.step2.passwo: The password for this network is:
hardwareAssembly.wifiConfig.step3.title: Access the Configuration Portal
hardwareAssembly.wifiConfig.step3.descri: After connecting to the network, your phone may open the portal automatically. If not, open a browser and type the following IP address:
hardwareAssembly.wifiConfig.step4.title: Configure Your Network
hardwareAssembly.wifiConfig.step4.descri: In the portal, click "Configure WiFi". Select your main Wi-Fi network from the list, enter its password, and click "save". The device will restart and automatically connect to your network. From now on, it will remember this network.
traceability.pageDescription: Record all important information for each cocoa lot to ensure quality and traceability.
traceability.formDescription: Fill in all the fields below to create a new record.
traceability.lotDescriptionPlaceholder: E.g., Cocoa from the June harvest

traceability.qrCodeDescription: The QR Code below contains all the lot information. Print it to attach to the physical lot.
traceability.saveSuccessDescription: The traceability record was saved and the QR code has been generated.
traceability.qrCodeErrorDescription: Could not generate the QR code for this lot.
traceability.savedLotsDescription: View and manage all the cocoa lots you have registered.
traceability.noLotsFound: No lots registered yet. Start by registering a new lot.
traceability.saveErrorNoUser: Access key not found. Cannot save lot.
deviceConfigurator.title: ESP32 Code Configurator
deviceConfigurator.description: Generate code for your device. Choose between a universal code (with a configuration portal) or one with hardcoded WiFi credentials.
deviceConfigurator.formDescription: Select the configuration type and fill in the required fields.
deviceConfigurator.appUrlDescription: Enter the base URL of your application (e.g., https://your-app.vercel.app). The /api/sensor path will be added automatically.
deviceConfigurator.pinDescription: Data pin for the DS18B20 sensor. Default is 4.
deviceConfigurator.intervalDescription: Frequency of data transmission. Default is 30s.
deviceConfigurator.generatedCodeDescript: Copy, paste into your Arduino IDE, and install the necessary libraries via the Library Manager.
deviceConfigurator.errorDescription: Please fill in the Application URL.
deviceConfigurator.errorCredentials: For hardcoded credentials, SSID and password are required.
deviceConfigurator.copySuccessDescriptio: The code has been copied to your clipboard.
esphome.title: YAML Configurator for ESPHome
esphome.description: Generate the YAML configuration code for your ESP32 device to be used with ESPHome and Home Assistant.
esphome.formDescription: Fill in the fields below. The generated code should be pasted into your ESPHome dashboard.
esphome.deviceNameDescription: Use lowercase letters, numbers, and underscores. This will be the device name on the network.
esphome.generatedCodeDescription: Copy this code and paste it into a new device in the ESPHome dashboard.
dataAnalysis.pageDescription: Explore advanced visualizations of your sensor behavior and alert frequency to identify patterns and optimize operations.
dataAnalysis.pieChart.title: Status Distribution per Sensor
dataAnalysis.pieChart.description: Percentage of time each sensor has been in 'Normal', 'Warning', or 'Critical' state.
dataAnalysis.barChart.title: Alert Frequency by Level
dataAnalysis.barChart.description: Count of 'Warning' and 'Critical' alerts grouped by day to identify incident peaks.
dataAnalysis.heatmap.title: Alert Activity Calendar (Heatmap)
dataAnalysis.heatmap.description: Visualize alert intensity throughout the year. Darker days indicate a higher occurrence of alerts.

whoWeAre.title: Who We Are: Innovation and Passion for Agribusiness
whoWeAre.subtitle: Understand our mission, vision, and the values that drive VigiaTemp.
whoWeAre.aboutUs.title: About Us
whoWeAre.aboutUs.p1: We were born from the union of passion for technology and deep respect for the field. We are a team of developers and agribusiness enthusiasts who have seen firsthand the challenges faced by producers seeking excellence. VigiaTemp arose from a real need: to create an accessible, intelligent, and reliable solution to monitor critical processes that define the quality of entire harvests, such as cocoa fermentation.
whoWeAre.mission.title: Our Mission
whoWeAre.mission.p1: Our mission is to empower the rural producer with cutting-edge tools. We believe that technology should not be a privilege, but a powerful ally for everyone. That's why we developed a system that transforms complex temperature data into visual, clear, and actionable information. We want you to have full control of your process, in the palm of your hand, allowing for faster and more accurate decision-making.
whoWeAre.vision.title: Vision for the Future
whoWeAre.vision.p1: We look to the future with the certainty that innovation is the path to a more sustainable and productive agribusiness. VigiaTemp is just the beginning. We are constantly researching and developing new features, from predictive analysis with artificial intelligence to integration with other sensors, always with the goal of delivering more value, security, and peace of mind to those who produce.
whoWeare.vision.p2: We are more than just a software company; we are partners in your journey for quality.
